decision_conditions: The use to which this permission relates shall not commence until the 2.4m high mesh fencing with 2.6m high 100mm knotless netting above, enclosure around the All weather Pitch is installed as shown in the approved drawing 20-006 Rev D2 Proposed Elevations and is thereafter maintained as such for the life of the proposed development.Reason: In order to safeguard the amenities of neighbouring occupiers and accord with policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core strategy April 2012.

The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

Prior to commencement of groundworks (excluding site investigations and demolition), a revised drainage strategy (compliant with standard sustainable drainage guidance which includes a pre-planning enquiry from Thames Water to support proposed discharge rates), revised drainage calculations (addressing half-drain-down time concerns), a revised detailed drainage layout (confirming invert levels of drainage components) and a maintenance plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planningauthority. The system shall be implemented and thereafter managed and maintained in accordance with the approved details.Reason: To prevent the risk of flooding to and from the site in accordance with Policy SI 13 of the London Plan 2021, the Sustainable Design and Construction SPG 2014, the Non-Statutory Technical Standards for Sustainable Drainage Systems 2015 and policy DM4 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

No building hereby permitted shall be occupied until evidence (photographs and installation contracts) is submitted to demonstrate that the sustainable drainage scheme for the site has been completed in accordance with the submitted details. Also, who shall be responsible for the maintenance for all drainage components must be confirmed to demonstrate how the drainagesystem is to be maintained for the lifetime of the development. The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.Reason: To comply with the Non-Statutory Technical Standards for Sustainable Drainage Systems, the National Planning Policy Framework (Paragraph 103), the London Plan (Policies SI 12 and SI 13) along with associated guidance to these policies and Kingston Council's Core Strategy Policy DM4.

Prior to the commencement of the use of the development to which this permission relates, the recommendations contained within the deposited MKA Preliminary Ecological Assessment including the preparation and submission of a Landscape and Ecology Management Plan (LEMP) shall be implemented in full, prior to the use of the facilities hereby approved, and permanentlyretained thereafter.Reason: To safeguard the biodiversity and nature conservation value of the site, in accordance with policy G6 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS3 and DM6 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

No development shall commence until full details of the design and layout of the 3G Artificial Grass Pitch have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The 3G Artificial Grass Pitch shall not be constructed other than in accordance with the approved details.Reason: To ensure the development is fit for purpose and sustainable and to accord with Development Plan Policy

Use of the development shall not commence until:(a) certification that the Artificial Grass Pitch hereby permitted has met FIFA Quality Concept for Football Turf - FIFA Quality or equivalent International Artificial Turf Standard (IMS) and(b) confirmation that the facility has been registered on the Football Association's Register of Football Turf Pitches have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure the development is fit for purpose and sustainable, provides sporting benefits and to accord with Development Plan Policy

Use of the development shall not commence until a community use agreement prepared and been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and a copy of the completed approved agreement has been provided to the Local Planning Authority. The agreement shall apply to the 3G Artificial Grass Pitch, the Padel Court and ancillary supportingfacilities including toilets, change and parking and include details of pricing policy, hours of use, access by nonmembers, management responsibilities and a mechanism for review. The development shall not be used otherwise than in strict compliance with the approved agreement.Reason: To secure well managed safe community access to the sports facilities, to ensure sufficient benefit to the development of sport and to accord with Development Plan Policy

The All weather pitch and padel tennis courts to which this permission relates shall not open outside of the following hours:0900hrs and 2300hrs Monday to Friday0900hrs and 2300hrs on Saturdays0900hrs and 2200hrs on Sundays and bank holidaysReason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The lighting columns to which this permission relates shall have a maximum illumination of an average of 200 lux for the all weather pitch and a maximum average of 300 lux for the padel tennis courts and all lighting hereby approved shall be turned off when the all weather pitch or padel tennis courts, to which the lights relate, are not in use.Reason: In order to protect the character and amenity of the area and accord with policies CS8 and DM10 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012.

Prior to the commencement of the development an Urban Greening Factor (UGF) assessment shall be undertaken and submitted to the Local Planning Authority to ensure that the proposed development is able to deliver an urban greening factor of 0.3. Prior to the use of the facilities hereby approved the measure required to achieve an UGF of 0.3 shall be delivered.Reason: In the interests of urban greening and to accord with Policy G5 of the London Plan 2021.

Prior to the commencement of the use of the development to which this permission relates, a Fire Safety Strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The Fire Safety Strategy shall demonstrate how the development will achieve the highest standards of fire safety and shall include the following details:1) suitably positioned outside space for fire appliances/ an evacuationassembly point;2) Appropriate fire alarm systems;3) Passive and active fire safety measures;4) appropriate construction details to minimise the risk of fire spread;5) provision of suitable and convenient means of escape/ an evacuationstrategy;6) provision of suitable access and equipment for firefighting which is appropriate for the size and use of the development.The Fire Safety Strategy shall include a statement of competence. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Strategy and thereafter maintained.The required Fire Safety Strategy shall reference the London Plan Guidance Fire Safety (February 2022), where applicable and a Reasonable Exception Statement (RES) shall be submitted in relation to those fire safety requirements which the applicant does not consider to be relevant.Reason: In the interests of fire safety and to ensure the safety of all building users in accordance with Policy D12 (Fire Safety) of the London Plan 2021.
description: Development of a full sized all weather football pitch and six padel tennis courts with associated means of enclosure including fencing and netting, 8m high 12 nos floodlighting, 15m high 8nos floodlights  and associated works.
